availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses Malone (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror. Tennessee native. Married to Rebecca Randolph Malone in Trigg County, Kentucky, on November 24, 1836. Father of Maranda F. Malone Flood, Thomas D. Malone, Alexander Malone, William Malone, James K. Polk Malone, Matilda Malone, Louisa Caroline Malone, John R. Malone, Nancy Malone, Jefferson Davis Malone, and George Lee Malone. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Juror in the Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas B. Wadlington in Caldwell County on December 8, 1860.
